result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie Ann Schaar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

C31_1 - Schaar, Carrie Ann.docx

3:14 PM 
Defendant Carrie Ann Schaar in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Carrie Ann Schaar.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" - Both Counts.
Court questions defendant re: her plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motion.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 1 Year.
-Costs
-I Day sentence credit
-Restitution to Victim in the amount of $472.00
-No contact with Loren Bowen except for counseling purposes
